team:
{"bio":"Mohammed is a Senior Litigation Solicitor with a wealth of experience in landlord and tenant law. Over the years, Mohammed has expertise in resolving complex disputes for both commercial and residential clients, which has equipped me with a deep understanding of the intricacies involved in property law. Mohammed has managed numerous high-value cases and provided legal advice on a spectrum of issues, including rent arrears, eviction proceedings, leasehold disputes, and tenant rights. Mohammed's commitment lies in delivering customized solutions that effectively protect my clients' interests, all the while maintaining the utmost professionalism and precision in navigating property law challenges.

With a solid foundation in both property and general civil litigation, Mohammed's approach to disputes is both sensible and pragmatic. Whether you are a landlord or a tenant, he strives to assist you in addressing disputes efficiently and effectively, working toward a favorable outcome. Mohammed's services extend to supporting debt recovery processes, consulting with clients on a diverse range of civil and general litigation matters, and ensuring that all aspects of your case are handled with care and expertise.

As a qualified mediator, he also prioritises resolving disputes through negotiation, mediation, or arbitration. However, should those methods prove unsuccessful, he is fully prepared to support you through any claims or defenses in civil courts or tribunals to secure the best possible outcome. Mohammed's areas of specialism include, but are not limited to, reviews of rental agreements, lease renewals, possession proceedings, and the preparation of tenancy agreements.

Mohammed is also well-versed in addressing issues related to health and safety, anti-social behavior by tenants, tenancy deposit disputes, and defending against eviction processes pursuant to Section 8 and 21 Notices.

Mohammed is also dedicated to providing comprehensive legal services, including high-value debt recovery, alternative dispute resolution, and asset tracing. Mohammed's knowledge extends to commercial contract disputes, enforceability of international judgments in the UK, and international arbitration processes.","image":null,"skills":["Reviews of Rental","Renewal of Leases","Surrender of Tenancy","Taking possession of a Rental Property","Dispute Settlement Between Landlords and Tenants","Preparation of tenancy agreements","Possession of anti-social behaviour","Removing troublesome tenants through the legal system","The defence of tenants' actions","The act of serving notices","Tenant's obligations and rights","Resolving Issues with tenancy deposit","Claims of disrepair","Defending against eviction","Section 8 and 21 Notice","Asset Tracing","Commercial Contract Disputes","Breach of Contract","High Value Debt Recovery","Alternative Dispute Resolution","Fraud and Asset Recovery","Director's Duties","Enforcing US and International Judgements in the UK","Freezing Injunctions and Orders","International Arbitration"],"education":"","job_title":"Senior Litigation Solicitor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Litigation","github_url":null,"description":"Mohammed is a Senior Litigation Solicitor with a wealth of experience in landlord and tenant law, specializing in resolving complex disputes for both commercial and residential clients.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-mohammed-attique/","display_order":1,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":null,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":null}
